name: Mexican Smashoff
storyline:
In this dystopic alternate reality, the Mexican Revolution, which transformed the country from a semi-colonial dictatorship into a chaotic republican democracy, suffers an unexpected Intervention. Questions about who these people are and what they want are tossed aside, as the distinct factions at war are quick to learn, adapt and apply the new technologies they brought, and use them to improve their machines and break the barriers of nature when adapting cybernetics, nanotechnology and genetic editing to soldiers and civilians alike.
In this new world, who will win the war? Will it be a war worth winning?
summary:
A single or multiplayer2D strategy board game that combines Chess, collectible card games, and turn-based battle games. All set in a Cyber-Punk version of the Mexican Revolutionary period.
This game combines game mechanics from chess, turn based strategy and card collection games.
The player chooses a Leader and assembles a team of fighters from a roster of distinct characters, and summon them one by one on a chess-like 2D board, where they can alternate between moving, attacking and defending each other's Leader.
